topic.title: User data on Zeronet android
topic.body: Where does Zeronet stores the user data files on android?I would like to backup my identity,but cannot find anything

1_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X.body:
> [tempuser12345678]
I was just thinking about the same thing,as I first read the article..

5_14UupgrdnT7Y8vMES7aqUFgD1fC5RYNrh8.body:
My P9 lite running android 6.0
Benchmarking ZeroNet 0.5.4 (rev2067) Python 2.7.2 (default, May 14 2017, 08:45:38) [GCC 4.8] on: linux4...

CryptBitcoin:
- hdPrivatekey x 10..........0.673s [x1.04: OK]
- sign x 10..........0.336s [x1.04: OK]
- openssl verify x 100...not avalible :(
- pure-python verify x 10..........0.959s [x1.67: Fine]

CryptHash:
- sha256 5M x 10..........0.730s [x0.82: OK]
- sha512 5M x 10..........2.474s [x0.24: Sloooow]
- os.urandom(256) x 1000..........0.068s [x0.10: Sloooow]

Msgpack: (version: 0.4.7)
- pack 5K x 10 000..........1.328s [x0.59: Goodish]
- unpack 5K x 10 000..........2.288s [x0.52: Goodish]
- streaming unpack 5K x 10 000..........2.486s [x0.56: Goodish]

Db: (version: 3.15.1, API: 2.6.0)
- Open x 10..........0.039s [x3.29: WOW]
- Insert x 10 x 1000..........2.998s [x0.33: Ehh]
- Buffered insert x 100 x 100..........3.595s [x0.36: Ehh]
- Total rows in db: 20000
- Indexed query x 1000..........0.363s [x0.69: Goodish]
- Not indexed query x 100..........0.792s [x0.76: Goodish]
- Like query x 100..........1.905s [x0.95: OK]

Compression:
- Zip pack x 10..........0.230s [x0.52: Goodish]
- Zip unpack x 10..........0.036s [x5.63: Insane!!]
- Tar.gz pack x 10..........0.548s [x0.55: Goodish]
- Tar.gz unpack x 10..........0.031s [x6.41: Insane!!]
- Tar.bz2 pack x 10
! Error: bz2 module is not available
0.001s [x1469.37: Insane!!]
- Tar.bz2 unpack x 10
! Error: bz2 module is not available
0.001s [x365.74: Insane!!]

Done. Total: 22.21s

Nofish,would it be a hard work to solve these things?mainly the 64bit compilation and the multi-thread support.nowadays all android devices have high corecount 64 bit cpus,for example my P9 has 8 cores.if we could utilize those,that should be a huge improvement.it can even help on desktop pcs(with FX or Phenom II cpus),but for start it would be great to try it out on the android version.if it's not a huge work of course :D
Now I see.yes,so in the end of the day multithreading isn't that easy but it would be beneficial for most of the zeronet users.bad thing is that python doesn't "like" multithreading by nature..

1_1KuwwnkAtVrfnyhv8pyGRxLqzNZbEkJt2u.body: I will also come,since I live next to Budapest,and it sounds fun :) make some new friends with the same interests,I'm looking forward to it!
Oh,I almost forgot today is the meetup..I didn't plan it out enough,but I will try to be there :)
